Trait description: Describes the consistency of a rice gel formed by grinding, chemically treating, boiling, and cooling a sample of grains. This measures the tendency of cooked rice to harden on cooling, a function of carbohydrate composition
Method description: Place 0.1g ground rice in a test tube with thymol blue (0.025% in ethanol, 0.2 ml) and KOH (0.2N, 2 ml). Shake the tube to mix contents, boil (8 min), rest (5 min) and then place in an ice-bath (15 min). Lay cooled tubes flat on graph paper for 1 hour, and then measure the distance that the gel travels . Included standards, as the age of the rice, degree of milling and operator skill affect reproducibility: IR48 (85?90 mm), IR32 (72-75 mm) and IR42 (30-32 mm).

Category 1: 1= Kernel not affected but chalky, high gel temp (>74C)
Category 3: 3= Kernel swollen with collar incomplete or narrow, high-intermediate gel temp
Category 4: 4= Kernel swollen with collar complete and wide, intermediate gel temp
Category 5: 5= Split or segmented with collar complete and wide, intermediate gel temp
Category 6: 6= Dispersed mergingwith collar, low gel temp (<70C)
Category 7: 7= Completely dispersed and cleared, low gel temp (<70C)

Trait description: Temperature at which the starch in endosperm gelatinizes, one of the key indicators of cooking quality
Method description: Gradually heat a sample of milled rice using a Differential Scanning Calorimeter (DSC), which measures the energy expended to raise the temperature of starch crystals as they gelatinize and melt. The temperature at which energy expenditure is maximum (peak temperature) provides a precise measure of gelatinization temperature.

Method name: Image analysis - Root diameter using WinRhizo in SITIS platform

Trait description: The extent to which plant growth is adversely affected by drought. Leaf rolling precedes leaf drying during drought.
